abstract: Moberly, Mo., was happy to guarantee bonds for a Chinese-owned plant that promised to bring jobs to town. But when it failed, the city walked away from the bonds.
snippet: Moberly, Mo., was happy to guarantee bonds for a Chinese-owned plant that promised to bring jobs to town. But when it failed, the city walked away from the bonds.
lead_paragraph: Residents of Moberly, Mo., got a shock last year when they discovered that their city had guaranteed $39 million in bonds, sold by an independent authority, to help a Chinese company build a plant to make sucralose, an artificial sweetener.

headline.main: A Town That Backed a Failed Project Refuses to Pay
headline.print_headline: A Town That Backed a Failed Project Refuses to Pay
